title: Phone Numbers | 2 of 2
question_text:
A statistics teacher collected data on the last digit of her $50$ students’ home or cell phone numbers. She remarked that the results were very similar to choosing $50$ digits from a random digits table.
What would the distribution of the last digit of the $50$ students’ phone numbers look like, and what would you expect the mean to be?

choices.text:
Histogram with a bell shape
Mean = 5

The shape of the distribution will be flat, with no humps, since each digit is equally likely. This flat shape is called a uniform distribution.

It will be a discrete uniform distribution since only whole number digits can be possible answers, unlike a continuous uniform distribution, which has a flat shape, but there is an infinite number of possible values, such as
